2.text: How long will ye vex my soul, And crush me with words?

3.text: These ten times have ye reproached me; Ye are not ashamed that ye deal harshly with me.

4.text: And be it indeed that I have erred, Mine error remaineth with myself.

5.text: If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me, And plead against me my reproach;

6.text: Know now that God hath subverted my cause, And hath compassed me with His net.

7.text: Behold, I cry out: ‘Violence!’ but I am not heard; I cry aloud, but there is no justice.

8.text: He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, And hath set darkness in my paths.

9.text: He hath stripped me of my glory, And taken the crown from my head.

10.text: He hath broken me down on every side, and I am gone; And my hope hath He plucked up like a tree.

11.text: He hath also kindled His wrath against me, And He counteth me unto Him as one of His adversaries.

12.text: His troops come on together, And cast up their way against me, And encamp round about my tent.

13.text: He hath put my brethren far from me, And mine acquaintance are wholly estranged from me.

14.text: My kinsfolk have failed, And my familiar friends have forgotten me.

15.text: They that dwell in my house, and my maids, count me for a stranger; I am become an alien in their sight.

16.text: I call unto my servant, and he giveth me no answer, Though I entreat him with my mouth.

17.text: My breath is abhorred of my wife, And I am loathsome to the children of my tribe.

18.text: Even urchins despised me; If I arise, they speak against me.

19.text: All my intimate friends abhor me; And they whom I loved are turned against me.

20.text: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, And I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.

21.text: Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; For the hand of God hath touched me.

22.text: Why do ye persecute me as God, And are not satisfied with my flesh?

23.text: Oh that my words were now written! Oh that they were inscribed in a book!

24.text: That with an iron pen and lead They were graven in the rock for ever!

25.text: But as for me, I know that my Redeemer liveth, And that He will witness at the last upon the dust;

26.text: And when after my skin this is destroyed, Then without my flesh shall I see God;

27.text: Whom I, even I, shall see for myself, And mine eyes shall behold, and not another’s. My reins are consumed within me.

28.text: If ye say: ‘How we will persecute him!’ Seeing that the root of the matter is found in me;

29.text: Be ye afraid of the sword; For wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword, That ye may know there is a judgment.
